content.value:
I hate that git knows the command to use when I want to push a branch that doesn't exist on the remote as an upstream and somehow doesn't have a flag that allows me to just run the command it knows I want to run.

just let me `git push --create-upstream-on-remote` or something
content.html: I hate that git knows the command to use when I want to push a branch that doesn't exist on the remote as an upstream and somehow doesn't have a flag that allows me to just run the command it knows I want to run. just let me `git push --create-upstream-on-remote` or something

photo.alt:
Screenshot of my terminal with the following text:

~/GitHub/nodejs/community-committee on bnb/linkinator-action! âŒš 12:24:06
$ git push                           
fatal: The current branch bnb/linkinator-action has no upstream branch.
To push the current branch and set the remote as upstream, use

    git push --set-upstream origin bnb/linkinator-action
